body:
@revans2 Sorry I have been busy with other works. 
Code change looks good, and manually tested with ExclamationTopology for local mode and SQL (order_tsv_csv) for cluster mode.
Great works!

+1

kabhwan:

Thanks Robert Joseph Evans for great work. I merged into master.
Users should provide the path to jaas.conf which includes a section named "KafkaClient" in storm.yaml or .

@ptgoetz @HeartSaVioR I would appreciate a review of this.  I would like to know what people think about it.  If it is good I am happy to add in more documentation and to rip out the rename hack code, as it would no longer really be needed.
OK Still +1
Now that STORM-2447 is in I have rebased this on master.

@knusbaum please take a look at this.

There were a number of changes here.  Some to replace functionality being used from clojure runtime with java code.  Some of it was moving/deduplicating dependencies, but the two big ones were adding in support to register the clojure kryo serialization transparently and making a tuple have the same clojure integration it had before by replacing it with a new tuple.

revans2:

Thanks Xin Wang,

I merged this into master.

I have been thinking about this, and I am not sure if a REGEX is really what we want.  Hadoop does this in a semi-standard way using auth_to_local rules like PAM does.

It might be worth lifting some of that code from hadoop and reusing it here instead of just a regular expression.

https://github.com/apache/hadoop/blob/trunk/hadoop-common-project/hadoop-auth/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/security/authentication/util/KerberosName.java
+1 looks good to me.
@liu-zhaokun More details are documented here http://kafka.apache.org/documentation.html#security_sasl . We don't need these changes on storm-kafka-client side
@ambud we should add the auth_to_local rules an make that as part of storm.yaml config option . Adding regex will not be helpful here.
@hmcc can you please up-merge your patch. I'll merge it into master & 1.x-branch
@harshach got it, let me work on the implementation and update the code.

Hello,@vesense 
Could you help me to merge this PR?

Hello, @vesense 
Could you help me to merge this PR?

Hello, @vesense 
Could you help me to merge this PR?

vesense:

Thanks liuzhaokun I merged this into master.

vesense:

Thanks liuzhaokun I merged this into master.

Hello, @harshach 
Yes,you are right.But I found there isn't 'sasl.jaas.config' in kafka 0.9.x, so I will create a new PR for storm 1.0.x-branch.
@ptgoetz and yes lets please do port this back
@jacobtolar please remove the line from the changelog.  It is too hard to keep it in sync while the code is reviewed.  We will add it back in when we merge it in.

revans2:

Great work Aki MÃ¤kinen. I merged this into master. If you want it in an older branch please let me know so I can pull it back.

satish.duggana:

Arun Mahadevan You may want to raise PR for 1.x-branch. I guess it does not introduce any backward incompatible change as the earlier API(getTimestamp) was not there in 1.x.
@harshach @HeartSaVioR Change rebased.

xc-:

It could be brought also to older supported versions as well, at least to 1.x releases. If needed, I can also create necessary pull requests, I just need to know which versions are still supported.
@vongosling @hustfxj Updated. Can you take a look again?

@liu-zhaokun you can set it via topology.worker.childopts or worker.childopts. Lets is not put work-around for this when there is viable option to set it. Also 0.9 consumer API is for Alpha and its not been used by anyone.

matthewdfleming:

+1 on this.. I think you should be shading those dependencies into different packages. If you look at storm-core, the shaded packages are under org.apache.storm.shade which works really well.

Julien Nioche the way I'm getting around this is the ordering within my pom.. if you put the dependency (that is in the jar but not the version you want to use) before the flux dependencies, the classpath ordering is maintained by maven. I haven't tried it in the shaded jar (for deployment) but there it's pretty ez to just strip out the non-shaded dependencies from within the flux-core jars on that but maybe the shade jar also considers the order of the dependencies (again don't know just yet)
@liu-zhaokun why are we including Server section intended for Zookeeper server in this file?
Sure, no problem.

ptgoetz:

Merged to master, 1.x-branch, 1.0.x-branch, and 0.10.x-branch.
@harshach Done :)

revans2:

Thanks Jacob Tolar,

I merged this into master.

@harshach 
Because the host  may be a Storm Server or a Zookeeper Server.Theoretically, they can use the same jaas.conf .
+1 Nice finding.

@harshach 
Just a reminder: 1.x branch now points to 1.1.1-SNAPSHOT rather than 1.2.0-SNAPSHOT, so we need to have discussion and set 1.x branch to 1.2.0-SNAPSHOT, or just merge into master and concentrate for 2.0.0.
@regisb Looks good overall without minor. Left comment.

kabhwan:

Satish Duggana
Let's add only merged versions to the Fix Version/s. It is a bit confusing whether the fix is applied to that version or not.

@harshach 
It doesn't work even I have set system property in the topology.But we can do it by setting the path to "java.security.auth.login.config" in the 'open' method of kafkaspout.

Hello, @vesense 
Sorry to bother you.Could you help me to review it?Thanks.

+1
Travis failing is only from integration test which seems unrelated.
+1 Nice finding.

kabhwan:

Thanks Renjie Liu, I merged into master and 1.x branch.

@HeartSaVioR 
I have squashed commits into one local and execute the 'git push' command.But the changes can't sync to the PR. Could you help me merge it as there is only one file changed actually?

@liu-zhaokun 
Did you push with --force?

@HeartSaVioR 
Oh, I forgot it.Thanks. Please help me merge it.

kabhwan:

Thanks liuzhaokun, I merged into master.

Site update will be done later, since I'm working on other things.

vongosling:

Apache RocketMQ new customer page is here, https://rocketmq.incubator.apache.org/customer/. It is just a incomplete statistics
Won't this break support for topologies that use multiple Kafka bolts with different producer properties (e.g. different ack settings)?
Great, thanks for the quick review and merge!

revans2:

I merged this into master. I don't think this is likely to be a problem on other branches but if someone else needs it on a separate branch we can merge it there quickly.
@knusbaum Can you help to merge this?

Hello, @HeartSaVioR 
Are you available to help me review this PR?

Hello, @vesense 
Are you available to help me review this PR?
This LGTM
Earlier test failure seems unrelated, was a windowing bolt test failure.
@srdo I addressed your review comments about empty map.
@revans2 I meant you could get rid of the emptyMap variables entirely.
@srdo can do. Wow you really don't like ugly code :)
@srdo done
@revans2 Sorry, didn't mean to nitpick you to death :) +1

@srdo please continue to nit pick.  I like good clean code and I am happy to see people call me out on things that should be fixed.  I find that people who read the code closely and nit pick find more serious bugs during the review which saves me a lot of time debugging and fixing them later on.

Thanks @hmcc merged into master.
@HeartSaVioR agree we can keep this in master and look at releasing 2.0 instead of back-porting.

Hi, @vesense long time no see.How are you?
Thanks for your reply,but also will trouble you to help me merge it.

vesense:

Thanks liuzhaokun I merged this into master.
Merged, and I added you to the contributors list.

@harshach 
If we can't promise time frame for 2.0, I'm OK to apply it for 1.x version line, given that storm-elasticsearch only supports EOL versions.

Hello, @harshach 
Looking forward to your reply.

@harshach 
Looking forward to your reply.
@vesense thank you. +1

arunmahadevan:

This was discussed in the dev mailing list and I think we agreed to reintroduce the storm-starter-topologies jar.

cc Jungtaek Lim
